Today I am going to show you How you set a color picker using BootstrapVue in VueJS?

Table of contains

  • Setup the Vue.js
  • Install the Bootstrap and BootstrapVue
  • Create FirstComponent.vue and import it into App.js
  • Add color picker

Let‚Äôs start today‚Äôs tutorial How do I set the color picker using BootstrapVue in VueJS?

Setup the Vue.js

First, we have to install the Vue project, I had installed the vueJS in my system. If you haven‚Äôt installed or have any problem with installation you can follow this article, which will show you step by step process of installation.

Install the Bootstrap and BootstrapVue

First, we have to install the Vue project, I had installed the vueJS in my system. If you haven‚Äôt installed or have any problem with installation you can follow this article, which will show you step by step process of installation. In that article, I had also show you how to install BootstrapVue in your vue.js project step by step.

How to install or configure vue-bootstrap in VueJS?

Create FirstComponent.vue and import it into App.js

Create the new component in the src/components/ components folder. the component name is FirstComponent.vue and imported into the App.js file:

App.js

<template>
  <div id="app">
    <FirstComponent />
  </div>
</template>

<script>
import FirstComponent from "./components/FirstComponent.vue";
export default {
  name: "App",
  components: {
    FirstComponent,
  },
};
</script>

<style>
#app {
  font-family: Avenir, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
  -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
  -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
  text-align: center;
  color: #2c3e50;
  margin-top: 60px;
}
</style>

Add color picker

Just as mentioned above, Now let‚Äôs start today‚Äôs tutorial, To set the color picker we are going to use the b-form-input component. For the color picker, we are going to use the type props. The b-form-input defaults to a text input, But there are different supported native browser HTML5 types which are text, password, email, number, URL, tel, search, date, DateTime, DateTime-local, month, week, time, range or color.

There is an alternative option for using to color picker that is:

  1. vue-colorpicker
  2. Verte
  3. v-color

For the tutorial, we are going to use the props type='color' with color type. Let‚Äôs understand through the example:

FirstComponent.vue

<template>
  <b-container fluid>
    <b-row>
      <b-col sm="6">
        <b-form-input type="color"></b-form-input>
      </b-col>
    </b-row>
  </b-container>
</template>

export default {
  name: "FirstComponent",
};
